page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The {Landscape}of the countryside in the {Biggar}area is very varied being a mixture of flat and hilly land.The area as a whole is over six hundred feet above sea level. The flat areas of the survey area are the remains of an old river system connected with the Tweed and {Clyde.}Both of these rivers probably flowed together in the Ice Age about ten thousand years ago. Geologically the {Biggar} area lies on the edge of a fault line ,which runs across the Southern Uplands.The hills behind {Biggar}are made of red felsite,which is part of an igneous intrusion.Inthe valley part ofthe area there is a mixture ofarable and stock farming ,whereas in the higher areas sheep tend to predominate.
